title: Welcome to the data governance information collection tool. Data governance comprises the policies, limitations, processes, and controls that address ethics, privacy protections, compliance, risk management, or other requirements for a given record linkage implementation across the data lifecycle.
description: This is a questionnaire to collect data governance information
purpose: The purpose of this questionnaire is to capture data governance information at the dataset level from research dataset owners

item.text: In this questionnaire, a policy is the foundation of governance information and is the source of rules (permissions and prohibitions) about how a dataset is handled across the data lifecycle. Laws, data use agreements, and consent forms are examples of policies. The questionnaire is framed by five phases of the data lifecycle: data collection, linkage, sharing, and secondary access and use, and asks the user to select parties to define who each rule applies to or comes from. In the context of this questionnaire, a data requester is an individual or organization that requests access to a dataset. Additionally, questionnaire response options allow a user to record when policies do not address a requested data governance topic (e.g., permission to link). The questionnaire also allows users to record values as unknown or enter custom values throughout.

Personally Identifiable Information is any information that can be used to distinguish or trace an individual's identity, either alone or when combined with other information that is linked or linkable to a specific individual

PPRL is a technique identifying and linking records that correspond to the same entity across several data sources held by different parties without revealing any sensitive information about these entities. Clear text refers to a message or data that has not been subject to encryption.

item.text: A consent is an IRB-approved written record that is in compliance with the Common Rule (45 CFR 46) and as applicable, Protection of Human Subjects rules (21 CFR 50), and is used to demonstrate the consent by a participant or guardian to participate in research. An assent form is considered a type of consent form.

valueCoding.display: CIPSEA: Confidential Information Protection and Statistical Efficiency
FERPA: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act

item.text: Select or enter the CIPSEA rules that apply to the dataset

answerCoding.display: CIPSEA: Confidential Information Protection and Statistical Efficiency

valueCoding.display: Permits data sharing with approved researchers who are designated agents
Guarantees confidentiality of participants and contributing organizations
Permits secondary data use for research
Supersedes the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) such that data collected under CIPSEA are not subject to FOIA

item.text: More information about CIPSEA https://www.cio.gov/handbook/it-laws/cipsea/
More information about FERPA https://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/guid/fpco/ferpa/index.html
Select or enter the FERPA rules that apply to the dataset

answerCoding.display: FERPA: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act

valueCoding.display: Permits sharing identified data for approved purposes [excludes research]

item.text: Select the HIPAA designated type of dataset.
More information about HIPAA available here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/index.html
Select or enter the HIPAA rules that apply to the dataset

valueCoding.display: Permits sharing of a deidentified dataset for research purposes
Permits sharing of limited dataset for research without participant consent by entering into a data use agreement with a recipient organization
Defines a limited dataset as a dataset where 16 categories of direct identifiers have been removed
Defines Safe Harbor and Expert Determination as the allowed methods for deidentification
Permits use of limited dataset for research without participant consent by entering into a data use agreement with a recipient
Permits data use for research with either 1) individual authorization (consent) or 2) IRB or a Privacy Board approval of waiver of consent requirement
Data de-identified according to HIPAA standards are no longer subject to HIPAA and can be used for research without participant consent

item.text: More information about the Common Rule https://www.hhs.gov/ohrp/regulations-and-policy/regulations/common-rule/index.html#:~:text=For%20all%20participating%20departments%20and,regulations%20of%20that%20department%2Fagency.
Select or enter the Common Rule rules that apply to the dataset

answerCoding.display: The Common Rule: 45 CFR 46 Part A

valueCoding.display: Permits human subjects research use of data with PII with either 1) participant consent or 2) IRB or a Privacy Board approval of consent waiver

item.text: More information about the privacy act https://www.justice.gov/opcl/privacy-act-1974
Select or enter the Privacy Act of 1974 rules that apply to the dataset

valueCoding.display: Permits collection of data that includes PII by federal agencies that have published a system of records notice (or “SORN”) in the Federal Register
Permits sharing of data with PII if federal agencies take the data into their SORN
Permits federal agency use of the data with PII if the federal agencies take the data into their SORN

valueCoding.display: Permits data sharing with approved researchers who are designated agents
